register.description: Monitor Control Register Offset = 0h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Monitor source selection. 0 = element count 1 = reserved 2 = reseved
Monitor Mode. 0 = disabled. 1 = push/pop statistics capture. 2 = low/high threshold checks. 3 = low/high watermarking. 4 = starvation counting.

register.description: Monitor Queue Register Offset = 4h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 1Fh
Monitor Data Register Offset = 8h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Monitor Data. For mode 1 this is read-only and number of pushes. For mode 2 this is read-write and the low threshold value. For mode 3 this is read only and the low watermark. For mode 4 this is read only and the starvation count.

register.description: Monitor Data Register Offset = Ch + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Monitor Data. For mode 1 this is read-only and number of pops. For mode 2 this is read-write and the high threshold value. For mode 3 this is read only and the high watermark. For mode 4 this is not used.
